ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Disparity between hosts summary and frontier report
ygData.msgSnippet: Which numbers in the report don t change, that you expect to change? The host report is mostly based on certain tallies that are updated in normal

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Disparity between hosts summary and frontier
 report
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=iS1tAJD7J0suTVei5NMcEN3bQm7n3j67oqro4iw2L_WX
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Which numbers in the report don't change, that you expect to change?

The host report is mostly based on certain tallies that are updated in 
normal discovery/completion/failure events, and may not be maintained 
via all possible 'surgical' code paths for direct-queue editing.

It might be appropriate to add such tally-updates to the methods you're 
using... or maybe those methods are very deep/local to the frontier, in 
which case the right approach might be to provide a higher-level 
interface that promises to both edit the frontier and update the crawl 
stats. More details on what you're doing would help qualify what the 
best behavior/interface should be...

- Gordon

On 10/15/13 5:34 PM, niels.van.hecke@... wrote:
>
>
> I was running some surgical scripts on my run and found that nothing I
> did was being reflected in the hosts summary. Things like deleting URIs
> from the frontier didn't change the inferred enqueued URIs from the host
> report. The results were reflected in the frontier report, however.
>
> Why does the host report not change to reflect the changes I made?
> Niels
>
>
>
